intro: Anthospermum mildbraedii, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its striking, night-blooming white flowers that emit a sweet fragrance. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are opposite in arrangement and are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dark seeds. Anthospermum mildbraedii is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
